author: Milton de la Cruz
post_text: November 20, 2019 at 4:14 AM#1HI GUYS!How I can to assign IGNORE EXECTIME via MACRO on a EXEC??Right now I´M using this Sintaxis ...ASSIGN EXEC X.Y /ignoreexectime = Onbuuuut, It´s not working yet!

posts.author: Milton de la Cruz
posts.post_text: November 20, 2019 at 4:14 AM#1HI GUYS!How I can to assign IGNORE EXECTIME via MACRO on a EXEC??Right now I´M using this Sintaxis ...ASSIGN EXEC X.Y /ignoreexectime = Onbuuuut, It´s not working yet!

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: November 20, 2019 at 7:04 AM#2please look in the commandline feedback, to check how the console interprets your syntax.Your syntax is not executed as you enter it:ASSIGN EXEC X.Y /ignoreexectime = On-->Assign Executor x.y On /ignoreexectimeIn this scenario the value you are trying to assign to the /option, is accidentally also a keyword, and the commandline preprocessor messes up your original syntax when sorting keywords and options.Please use a syntax variants where ON is not a freestanding entity, to make sure your entered syntax is being properly interpreted.e.g.Assign Executor x.y /IgnoreExecTime=OnAssign Executor x.y /IgnoreExecTime = "On"Assign Executor x.y /IgnoreExecTime = 1

title: IGNORE EXECTIME via MACRO
